92.
The relationships between the predictors and the dependent variable in partner countries are
analogous to those found in OECD countries. Bulgaria and Montenegro are an exception as in these
two countries, there is no difference in health career expectations between the two genders. The
largest differences are in Russia, Thailand and Lithuania.

figure.figDesc:
School level factors
121.
Prior studies of gender typed adolescent career plans found a number of school
characteristics which boost higher status expectations among students. These characteristics are
school resources, the compositional features of school populations and particular processes which
manifest in the formal and informal culture of school.
EDU/WKP(2011)3

text.figure:
EDU/WKP(2011)3 APPENDICES
Appendix 1: Additional descriptive tables
Appendix 1
EDU/WKP(2011)3 Appendix 3

figure.figDesc:
Country level estimates are in the third equation and subscript c denotes regression coefficients at this
level. Country-level covariates (X 00n=1 through X 00N ) correspond to regression coefficients (X 00n=1 through
X 00N ) while 000
η denotes the average intercept across countries. The error component 0c
h varies between
countries.

EDU/WKP(2011)3
81
THE OECD EDUCATION WORKING PAPERS SERIES ON LINE
The OECD Education Working Papers Series may be found at:
• The OECD Directorate for Education website: www.oecd.org/edu/workingpapers
• The OECD's online library, SourceOECD: www.sourceoecd.org
• The Research Papers in Economics (RePEc) website: www.repec.org
If you wish to be informed about the release of new OECD Education working papers, please:
• Go to www.oecd.org
• Click on " My OECD "
• Sign up and create an account with " My OECD "
